4.1.20  12:16 am   Bill, you make me want to cry with happiness. You are genuinely just an amazing person who is a stunning beacon of light in these dark times. Thank you for everything you do ever. I don't think the people who look up to you would ever be able to show their gratitude to you in a way that would do it justice. Your subtle wisdom and down-to-earth nature is inspiring. I hope to be as kind and creative as you are someday. Sorry this isn't a question. I just had to let you know.

html:
3.31.20  6:53 pm   What is a thing? Not an example of a thing, just what is a "thing" in general?

     Is a person a thing?

     If not, what category includes persons and things?

      What category includes persons, things, and places?

      Can two separate things be a thing?

      For example, a mote of dust in my room is a thing, and the Sloan Great Wall is a thing, but (assuming my room is not near the Sloan Great Wall) is a mote of dust + the Sloan Great Wall a thing?

     Why are there in some places more things and in some places less things?

      Why did things ever emerge?

      Why would nothingness be disturbed?

      Sure, it's the fault of all of us and everything that ever was, but there why is there us, and why is there everything that ever was? Why wasn't there just nothing, forever/never?
